Text: It's been a week. What did you find out, Alpha?

I'm sure you already know, but your father has still
not succeeded in capturing the bandits.
Figures. It seems like he's havin' a real hard time.

Just when I think he's come home, he eats dinner with
a sullen look on his face and goes right back out again...

The bandits are apparently quite skilled, and run off
the moment your father's group approaches.

It's almost as if there's a spy in his group,
alerting the bandits to their position so
they can escape...
I thought so as well, so I did some looking around...
You couldn't find anyone, right?
I was unsuccessful... I apologize.

Don't worry about it. If you couldn't find them,
it probably means there is no spy.

B-But...how else would the bandits be able to stay
one step ahead of your father's group?

(Who knows? I certainly don't... Not like I can tell
Alpha that, though.)

(Maybe this is my cue to pull out a mysterious
one-liner.)
Try thinking in reverse.
What...do you mean?

That's what you're here for, to think and put it
into action.

It's just as you say... I am too dependent on you.
I will immediately think of a plan of action andâ€”
I'm counting on you.

It's just as you said... It isn't your father's group
that is leaking information, but the side being
pillaged!

The magistrate's subordinates were sending a signal
to the bandits by calling the troops, and in response
the bandits retreated.

The victims are helping their attackers...it's
precisely thinking in reverse. I can't believe
you saw through it all.
Uh, right...

(I can't believe something I made up on the spot
turned out to be right.)

(But why is the magistrate working with the bandits?
Unless...)

It's a coup d'etat disguised as a bandit attack.
The bandits are just a pawn for the magistrate...
Who is playing a charade.

By bypassing Baron Kagenou and going straight to
the capital, he could topple the Kagenou family
and take their place...

So it means that we're caught up in a war between
the Kingdom's factions.

Yes, that sounds plausible. It's a clever plan,
if not executed a bit poorly.

(The old man's a softy, so I'll bet he got fleeced
pretty good. Minor nobles must make for easy
targets.)

(But the jig is up, and it's time to end this farce.
A corrupt magistrate, huh... Just like in a movie.)
Just as I think this, Alpha speaks up.

Just in case, I checked if the Cult of Diablos were
backing him... But they weren't.
Right...

(Sometimes Alpha plays along with my setups.
She's almost as smooth of an actor as Beta.)

If I may speak honestly, I think the magistrate is
being overly optimistic. I doubt he can keep the
bandits under his control for very long...

Even if he does manage to oust the Kagenou family,
I highly doubt the capital would give him a position
of power.

Are you saying that we should let him be,
'cause he's digging his own grave...?

Alpha freezes. It figures, I knew that's where this
conversation was going.

(Aha, there we go. Whenever I say something like that,
she usually follows my lead.)

I already told you, we're intervening. We have the
information we need, now I just need to take care
of it...alone.
But...
Alpha?
I-I'm sorry...!

She looks as if she has something else to say, but
presses her lips together and lowers her head.

Don't worry, it may be kinda dangerous and our
opponent will probably be prepared for us.

But I'll approach them from behind, that's the least
likely to be caught. You can probably say there's
zero chance of it, even.
Yes, of course I believe you will be victorious.
That's that, so I'm gonna head out now.
Cid... Please be careful...!

So I snuck out of the house and made my way to the
crooked magistrate's residence.

(If I take him out of the picture, the rest will fall
into place and the coup d'eta will fall apart
before it begins.)
(Okay... Time to show this guy what real power is.)
